extendedInfo.description: The ABCD2 Score is a quick clinical tool that can help predict an early risk of stroke in the first 2, 7, and 90 days after transient ischemic attack (TIA).The ABCD2 Score assesses the risk using five parameters:AgeBlood pressureClinical featuresDuration of TIADiabetes.The main features of the application are:-Getting the results with minimal screen touches-Small application size-Supporting devices with different screen size and orientation, including tablets-English and Russian languages-Manual language switching  (for a full version only)-E-mailing a detailed test report  (for a full version only)-No advertisement and banners-No odds!________________________________Example of detailed test report:Patient's ID: Smith JDate & Time: 26/11/2012 12:05Test: ABCDÂ² ScoreANSWERS: Age: â¥60 yearsBlood pressure: â¥140/90 mm HgClinical features: Unilateral weaknessDuration: â¥60 minutesDiabetes mellitus: YesRESULTS: Points: 7Risk: High Stroke Risk2-Day Risk: 8.1%7-Day Risk: 11.7%90-Day Risk: 17.8%________________________________Your feedback is very welcome.
